formalpara.title: Figure 4. The Wnt dependent migration of the Q neuroblast descendants.
formalpara.para: EGL-20/Wnt signaling activates the Hox gene mab-5 in QL to induce posterior migration of the QL descendants (QL.d). mab-5 is not activated in QR and as a consequence, the QR.d migrate in the default anterior direction. In mutants that disrupt EGL-20 signaling, mab-5 fails to be expressed in QL and the QL.d migrate towards the anterior. In pry-1/Axin mutants, mab-5 is ectopically expressed in QR and the QR.d migrate towards posterior positions.
